Create a Raster of Existing Protected Areas Aligned to Planning Units

make_protected_areas.Rd

This function generates a raster of protected areas for a given country, aligned to the planning units (pus). It optionally downloads the latest protected area data from the Protected Planet database via the wdpar package or uses an input sf object. All geometries are reprojected, dissolved to avoid double-counting overlaps, and converted to individual polygons to improve spatial intersection performance. The raster output represents the fractional area of each planning unit covered by protected areas.

Usage

make_protected_areas(
  from_wdpa = TRUE,
  iso3,
  download_path = NULL,
  sf_in,
  status = c("Established", "Inscribed", "Designated"),
  pa_def = 1,
  include_mab_designation = FALSE,
  buffer_points = TRUE,
  area_column = "REP_AREA",
  area_calc_crs = "ESRI:54009",
  nQuadSegs = 50,
  return_sf = TRUE,
  force_update = FALSE,
  pus,
  output_path = NULL
)

Arguments

from_wdpa

Logical. If TRUE, downloads protected area data using the wdpar package. If FALSE, uses sf_in.

iso3

Character. ISO3 code for the country of interest.

download_path

Character. Path where WDPA data will be saved or loaded from.

sf_in

An sf object containing protected area geometries. Used only if from_wdpa = FALSE.

status

Character vector. Which STATUS values to include from the WDPA data. Default is c("Established", "Inscribed", "Designated").

pa_def

Integer or vector of integers. Values for the PA_DEF column (1 = Protected Area; 0 = OECM). Only 1 is currently supported. Default is 1.

include_mab_designation

Logical. If FALSE, excludes Man and Biosphere (MAB) reserves.

buffer_points

Logical. If TRUE, creates geodesic buffers around POINT and MULTIPOINT features using area attributes.

area_column

Character. Column name indicating the area (used for buffering). Default is "REP_AREA".

area_calc_crs

Character. CRS to use for buffering operations. Default is "ESRI:54009" (World Mollweide).

nQuadSegs

Integer. Number of segments per quarter circle for buffers. Default is 50.

return_sf

Logical. If TRUE, assigns the dissolved individual polygons to current_protected_area_sf in the global environment for reuse. Default is TRUE.

force_update

Logical. If TRUE, forces re-download of WDPA data. Default is FALSE.

pus

A SpatRaster of planning units to which the protected areas will be aligned.

output_path

Optional. File path where the resulting raster should be saved.

Value

A SpatRaster representing the fractional coverage of protected areas in each planning unit.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
boundary_proj <- make_boundary(
 boundary_in = boundary_dat,
 iso3 = "NPL",
 iso3_column = "iso3cd"
 )

pus <- make_planning_units(
 boundary_proj = boundary_proj,
 pu_size = NULL
 )

pa_raster <- make_protected_areas(
  iso3 = "NPL",
  download_path = here::here(),
  buffer_points = TRUE,
  pus = pus,
  force_update = TRUE
)
} # }
